p: TQ was the main volatile oil component identified in this study (0.72%–21.03%). Some noticeable compounds such as t-butylhydroquinone (0.3%–11.5%), carvacrol (1.34%–4.83%), α-phellandrene (1.66%), longifolene (0.06%), pseudopelletierine (0.15%), neolignan (0.01%), eremophilene (0.18%), methyl palmitoleate (0.65%), limonene (0.32%), 1, 2 cuparene (0.1%), arsacol (0.43%), 2,3-epoxycarane, (E)-4-isopropyl-5-methylhexa-2,4-dien-1-ol (1.05%), 3-cyclohexene-1-carboxaldehyde,1,3,4-trimethyl (0.4%), tetraacetyl-d-xylonic nitrile (0.1%), thujol (0.12%), ocimene (0.09%), cis-p-mentha-2,8-dien-1-ol (0.32%), benzenemethanol, α,α,4-trimethyl (0.15%), ethyl iso-allocholate (0.08%), benzeneacetonitrile, 4-hydroxy (0.33%), 1-heptatriacontanol (2.06%), and butylated hydroxytoluene 1 (0.49%) were identified in essential oil obtained from Iranian and Indian N. sativa seeds.
